status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

kou commented on issue #5951: ARROW-7235: [C++] Add Result<T> APIs to IO layer
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5951#issuecomment-561842976
 
 
   Note: This change breaks API compatibility. If an user has custom input/output stream class, the code must be changed. For example, `arrow::Status CustomInputStream::Read(int64_t nbytes, int64_t* bytes_read, void* out) override` causes a build error.
   
   (I think that this is acceptable because we say that we may break API compatibility in each release.)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

bkietz commented on pull request #5951: ARROW-7235: [C++] Add Result<T> APIs to IO layer
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5951#discussion_r354454609
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/io/interfaces.h
 ##########
 @@ -189,30 +219,46 @@ class ARROW_EXPORT RandomAccessFile : public InputStream, public Seekable {
   static std::shared_ptr<InputStream> GetStream(std::shared_ptr<RandomAccessFile> file,
                                                 int64_t file_offset, int64_t nbytes);
 
-  virtual Status GetSize(int64_t* size) = 0;
+  /// Return the total file size in bytes.
+  virtual Result<int64_t> GetSize() = 0;
 
-  /// \brief Read nbytes at position, provide default implementations using
-  /// Read(...), but can be overridden. The default implementation is
-  /// thread-safe. It is unspecified whether this method updates the file
-  /// position or not.
+  /// \brief Read data from given file position.
+  ///
+  /// At most `nbytes` bytes are read.  The number of bytes read is returned
+  /// (it can be less than `nbytes` if EOF is reached).
+  ///
+  /// This method can be called by multiple threads concurrently.
 
 Review comment:
   ```suggestion
     /// This method can be safely called from multiple threads concurrently.
   ```

bkietz commented on pull request #5951: ARROW-7235: [C++] Add Result<T> APIs to IO layer
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5951#discussion_r354444621
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/parquet/exception.h
 ##########
 @@ -32,13 +32,24 @@
 #define ARROW_UNUSED(x) UNUSED(x)
 #endif
 
+// Parquet exception to Arrow Status
+
 #define PARQUET_CATCH_NOT_OK(s)                    \
   try {                                            \
     (s);                                           \
   } catch (const ::parquet::ParquetException& e) { \
     return ::arrow::Status::IOError(e.what());     \
   }
 
+#define PARQUET_CATCH_AND_RETURN(s)                \
+  try {                                            \
+    return (s);                                    \
+  } catch (const ::parquet::ParquetException& e) { \
 
 Review comment:
   Is it worth explicitly catching ParquetStatusException here (so that `Invalid` statuses don't get recast to `IOError`s?)

 ##########
 @@ -121,6 +121,17 @@ class Result;
   ASSERT_OK_AND_ASSIGN_IMPL(ARROW_ASSIGN_OR_RAISE_NAME(_error_or_value, __COUNTER__), \
                             lhs, rexpr);
 
+#define EXPECT_OK_AND_ASSIGN_IMPL(status_name, lhs, rexpr) \
+  auto status_name = (rexpr);                              \
+  ARROW_EXPECT_OK(status_name.status());                   \
+  if (status_name.ok()) {                                  \
+    lhs = std::move(status_name).ValueOrDie();             \
+  }
+
+#define EXPECT_OK_AND_ASSIGN(lhs, rexpr)                                              \
 
 Review comment:
   When you rebase, maybe implement this with ASSIGN_OR_HANDLE_ERROR_IMPL?
